page.title: 16DEVORAN SCHOOL'S HISTORY
page.content: Devoran school was built in 1846 by the National Society for the Education of the Established Church at a cost of Â£310. This included a Government grant of Â£65. In those days the school had only one classroom (measuring approximately 10m x 5m x 3m high) with 111 children aged from 2_11 packed into it, the infants up one end and the rest down the other with only two teachers! These were the headmaster and an assistant mist- ress. The children paid to go to school and the fees were called 'school pence'. Improvements in 1984 included lowered ceilings, new office and cloakrooms, covered porch, glazed doors, a foyer for display, an infant wet area and a raised garden bed. The school bell is still in place but no longer used.The toilets are still outside.
